full_summary:
## Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts Indexing Services
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) is seeking a qualified vendor to provide professional indexing services for the Aquatic Sciences and Fisheries Abstracts (ASFA) database.

## Date and Duration
### Notice Date
The notice date of this advance contract award notice is 2022-12-22.
### Tender Closing Date
The tender closing date is 2023-01-06 at 13:00:00.

## Purpose and Objectives
The purpose of this contract is to ensure the quality indexing of Canadian content in the ASFA database. The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada has a responsibility and an agreement with the FAO to ensure aquatic and fisheries Canadian content is indexed in ASFA. The objectives of this contract are to provide professional indexing services, enter data into the ASFA database, and ensure compliance with ASFA guidelines.

## Key Requirements
- The successful bidder must be a trained ASFA partner with significant experience in indexing DFO and Canadian publications.
- The bidder must have experience using the OpenASFA software and have knowledge of ASFA guidelines.
- The bidder must provide a minimum of 120 indexing contributions per month.
- The bidder must report directly to Darlene Tan, Digital and Systems Librarian.

## Essential Work Requirements
- Provide professional indexing services and enter data into the ASFA database according to ASFA guidelines.
- Take measures to prevent backlogs of indexing.
- Research and identify Canadian articles and publications for indexing.
- Create or edit abstracts for input into ASFA.
- Provide bi-weekly progress reports and annual reports on contributions made.

## Resources and Level of Effort
- The estimated level of effort for this requirement is 185 days for the initial contract period, and 185 days for each optional period.

## Mandatory Criteria
- Must be a trained ASFA partner.
- Must have knowledge of ASFA guidelines.
- Must have 5 years of experience indexing DFO publications.
- Must have 5 years of experience indexing Canadian publications.
- Must have 5 years of ASFA certified experience in data entry and indexing NAFO publications.
- Must have 2 years of experience using OpenASFA software.

## Contract Details
- The period of the contract is from contract award to 31 March 2024, inclusive.
- The contract includes 2 optional years, each of 1 year duration, under the same conditions and which will be activated at the discretion of DFO.
